result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Drey J. Harz

records.addlTxt:
2:37 PM cases 20CT258, 20CT298, 21CT192, 22CM09, 21CM524 called. Judge Bill Stewart for Judge Annette Barna. Defendant Drey J. Harz not in court and does not appear via Zoom.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
In 22CM09: State requests a warrant- So ordered. 
In 20CT258, 20CT298, 21CT192 and 21CM524: State moves to amend the Operating While Revoked in each case to a county ordinance to no driver's license on person 343.18(1). 
Court accepts State's motion, finds the defendant Guilty on each count of no driver's license on person and assesses court costs. Anything else in 20CT258, 20CT298, 21CT192 and 21CM524 is dismissed and read in. Any ride along citations are dismissed.

10:36 AM Cases called: 20CT258, 20CT298, 21CM524, 21CT192 & 22CM9. Judge Michael Schumacher for Branch 4 Intake. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Drey J. Harz in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. State requests that since there is no resolution that these cases be set for trial. 

All cases are referred to Br. 3 to schedule trials in 20CT258 & 20CT298.

11:25am Cases called: 22CM9, 21CT192, 20CT298, 20CT258 & 21CM524. Supplemental Court Commissioner Wendy Sue Johnson for Br. 1 Intake, Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Drey Harz appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Alicia Linzmeyer. Warrants executed. Previous bonds were not reinstated. State requests a $100 cash bond to cover all cases. Defense argues for a signature bond. Court orders a $100 cash bond. PTC: 06/06/22 at 2:15pm

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
(Covers 22CM9, 21CT192, 20CT298, 20CT258, 21CM524)

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
(Covers 22CM9, 21CT192, 20CT298, 20CT258, 21CM524)

10:00 AM Cases called: 20CT258, 20CT298, 21CM524, 21CT192, 22CM9. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Drey J. Harz not in court. Warrant ordered on all cases.

Conditions: 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.

(11:08 AM cases 20CT258, 20CT298, 21CT192, 21CM524, 22CM9 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Drey J. Harz appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared by video for Drey J. Harz.
Court orders the bonds in cases 20CT258, 20CT298, 21CT192, 21CM524 continue and the warrants are quashed.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint in 22CM9 and the warrant is quashed.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on February 28, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.

(11:37 AM cases 22CM9, 21CT192, 21CM524, 20CT298 called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Drey J. Harz does not appear in court or via Zoom.
Court orders warrants.
